item.title: [Release]My first model Dragon Sword[Release]
item.dc:creator: @BTheRipper BTheRipper
item.description:
@BTheRipper wrote:

Hey guys, this is the first model I’ve made. I tried to make a slayer helmet once but I didn’t know you could just use a model grabber for it :p… So I stopped halfway through. So technically this is the first model I’ve ever made… I’m still getting used to Metaseq.

Edit: Models were a bit messed up, I accidently forgot to make the sword a right handed weapon. heres the real models lol. http://uppit.com/v/TFNW1I6P

I would like to put this in my server… I’m new to Java. like brand new. so I don’t know how to make ints… i just copied the Statius Warhammer ints and changed them a little bit but it doesn’t work fully because when you rotate the screen at a perfect angle it won’t show the hilt, and part of the blade of the sword. so idk if its my Ints or my models. If someone could help me that would be great, my hotmail is x-blake-x@hotmail.com.

EDIT: here’s the ints. model might be a LITTLE fucked (turning invisible at a certain angle), but I’ll fix that soon.

if(i == 13455) //ID { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Weild"; class8.aString170 = "Dragon Sword"; //Name class8.aByteArray178 = "LOLWUT A DRAGON SWORD".getBytes(); //Description class8.anIntArray156 = new int[1]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[1]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = 61; class8.anIntArray160[0] = 5652; class8.anInt174 = 13456; class8.anInt181 = 860; class8.anInt190 = 100; class8.anInt198 = 1348; class8.anInt204 = 96; class8.anInt169 = -13; class8.anInt194 = -2; class8.anInt165 = 13455; class8.anInt200 = 13455; class8.anInt188 = -1; class8.anInt164 = -1; class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.anInt197 = -1; }

Please, constructive criticism only?

Read full topic
